result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

ADDRESS INFO for Brittany M. Ravis
Current: 1600 West Seminary Street Apt 5, Richland Center, WI 53581 United States  (Effective: 02-17-2017)
Prior: 511 S. Church St., Richland Center, WI

Defendant Brittany M. Ravis in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  3 cases called together for status:  16CM69, 16CM116, and 16CM117.  Counsel inform the Court that the parties have an agreement for resolution whereby def will plead to count 1/disorderly conduct in 16CM116 for dismissal of the remaining counts and cases.

Def pleads no contest to Count 1/DC of 16CM116.  Court's colloquy on plea.  Finding of guilty.  Sentence:  withheld for 12 mo probation.  Conditions:  attend, pay for, and succ. complete any educational programs or treatment as ordered by the department.  Court remits costs.  Court finds for expungement per 973.015 upon succ. completion of probation.

Remaining counts and 16CM69 and 16CM117 dismissed/read-in.
Status conference on November 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.

16CM116, 16CM117 and 16CM69/competency hearing. Defendant Brittany M. Ravis in court with attorney Lisa A McDougal. Prosecuting Atty Amy Elizabeth Forehand appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Forehand summarizes finding of report.  Atty. McDougal - def's position is that she is competent.  ADA - State does not dispute defense' position, noting that finding was made some time ago prior to def's present state.  Competency not being challenged by either side at this point, Court finds def is competent to proceed.  Atty. M asks for follow-up status.  Court sets 11/30 at 9.  Status conference scheduled for November 30, 2016 at 09:00 am.
(pages are scanned as they were received via fax filing)
Competency hearing on October 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.

16CM116 and 16CM117/competency hearing.  Attorney Lisa A McDougal in court for Defendant Brittany M. Ravis. Defendant Brittany M. Ravis not in court.  DA Harper appears for the State.  Court notes that competency report has not been received yet; evaluator has requested more time.  Def remains in Winnebago.  Court adjourns these matters to Oct. 25 at 1:30.  Competency hearing scheduled for October 25, 2016 at 01:30 pm.
Competency hearing on October 10, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Appearances:  Atty Forehand, Atty Lisa McDougal with Brittany Ravis. 16CM116 and 16CM117 called together.  Atty McDougal states agreeing to convert cash bond to a signature bond and requests not proceed with the initial appearances.  Court comments she already has a signature bond on 16 CM 116.  Court approves Amending $1,000 cash bond to $1000.000 signature bond in 16CM117.  Court notes that compentency has been challenged in both cases and requires a compentency exam.  Court sets Oct 10th at 11:30 set for a compentency hearing.  Court adjourned.
AMENDED to $1,000 signature bond from $1,000 cash
AMENDED to $1,000 signature bond from $1,000 cash
